greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum T(n,k) of the entries in the k-th cycles of all permutations of [n]; triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 1<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: Each cycle is written with the smallest element first and cycles are arranged in increasing order of their first elements.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..23, flattened
example: T(3,1) = 21 because the sum of the entries in the first cycles of all permutations of [3] ((123), (132), (12)(3), (13)(2), (1)(23), (1)(2)(3)) is 6+6+3+4+1+1 = 21.
maple: T:= proc(h) option remember; local b; b:=
mathematica: Table[T[n], {n, 1, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 25 2018, translated from Maple *)
xref: Row sums give A000142 * A000217 = A180119.
Main diagonal and first lower diagonal give: A000027, A006000 (for n>0).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 19 2017
